name: Caravan
comments: I think they were hippie's I could smell petchulie
The smell from that caravan on tour indicates to me that he died a long time ago.
it's nice to see that he's on tour.
MERCY! I had to get up and dance.
Mike Corleone and I had a meeting at the Cabaret in CUBA when I first heard this song.
aweosme
I love it! It's like heavy ragtime jazz from the 20s, the cat's pajamas!!!
TAKE A LONG WALK THRU DA PARK... AND ENJOY THIS...
o man... this one's a kepper
Visions of Harlem New York on this one!
Smooth and Easy...SMILE ALL THE TIME :)
the soloists are on good form here, namely cootie, lawerence and barney.
not quite up to the usual standard, and I am an Ellington collector. The arrangement is a little disjointed.
Prefer this version to the one I have which is played too fast. This tempo is much better. I love it.
Caravan is my favourite Duke Ellington composition and I love this version.
A wonderful, winding and triumphant sounding version of Caravan unlike any other I have ever heard.....
Real good, this one. All Ellington´s Caravans are good (Michel Petrucciani's as well), but this one is unique.
Loving the ska feel to this one. It's really out there.
composed by Juan Tizol
awesome jazz musician, but how is he "on tour" if he died over 30 years ago?????
